messages.content:
As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: HOUSTON POLICE DEPARTMENT
CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION COMMAND
Property Crimes Division
SIGNAL: 62P
ITEM NUMBER: P-62078-25
PAGE 21 of 61
CASE SUPERVISORS:
Lt. Jacob Martinez
Sgt. Angela Thompson
CASE INVESTIGATOR:
Det. Emily Clark
ASSISTING DETECTIVES:
Sgt. Brian Lopez
Sgt. Rebecca Harris
( Burglary and Theft Unit)
Det. Michael Reed
Det. Sarah Johnson
( Burglary and Theft Unit)
Det. David Lee
( Burglary and Theft Unit)
Det. Linda Wilson
Det. Kevin Rogers
(General Assignment)
Det. Rachel Adams
(White Collar Crimes Unit)
Det. Mark Gonzalez
(Fraud Investigation Unit)
VICTIM:
JOHN DOE, male, local shop owner.
DATE, TIME, and
LOCATION of OFFENSE:
30 SEPTEMBER 2025 at around 7:00 PM in the Heights area.
REPORTING OFFICER:
BADGE:
Det. Emily Clark
4512
Throughout the investigation, a myriad of contradictory statements and incomplete security footage added complexity. Officer Hernandez, on patrol in the Heights, was among the first to discover signs of the break-in. He was soon joined by Sgt. Brian Lopez and Patrol Officer Davis, who worked to secure the crime scene. Technician Miller, experienced in forensic locksmithing, was brought in to analyze the entry methods. Criminalist Parker, thoroughly examining the scene, identified unique tool marks that were crucial in identifying a method of entry. Coroner Dr. Brown was involved to assess an injured individual found nearby, providing unexpected clues to the property crime. Patrol Officer Gonzalez, engaging with surrounding businesses, collected testimonies that shed light on suspicious activities prior to the incident.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lt. Jacob Martinez Officer Context: Supervised the case in the Property Crimes Division. Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Sgt. Angela Thompson Officer Context: Co-supervisor of the case with Lt. Martinez. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Emily Clark Officer Context: Lead investigator of the property crime case, reporting officer. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Sgt. Brian Lopez Officer Context: Assisted at the break-in scene, part of the Burglary and Theft Unit. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sgt. Rebecca Harris Officer Context: Burglary and Theft Unit sergeant, supported the operation. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Det. Michael Reed Officer Context: Burglary and Theft Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Sarah Johnson Officer Context: Involved in the case, from the Burglary and Theft Unit. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. David Lee Officer Context: Burglary and Theft Unit detective, assisted in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Linda Wilson Officer Context: General assignment detective, part of the investigative team. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Kevin Rogers Officer Context: General Assignment detective, assisted in the property crime case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Rachel Adams Officer Context: White Collar Crimes Unit detective, involved in the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Det. Mark Gonzalez Officer Context: Fraud Investigation Unit detective, contributed to the case. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Officer Hernandez Officer Context: First to discover signs of the break-in in the Heights area. Officer Role: Patrolling Officer Officer Name: Patrol Officer Davis Officer Context: Assisted in securing the break-in scene. Officer Role: Patrol Officer Officer Name: Technician Miller Officer Context: Specialized in forensic locksmithing, analyzed entry methods. Officer Role: Forensic Technician Officer Name: Criminalist Parker Officer Context: Examined the scene, identified unique tool marks linked to entry method. Officer Role: Criminalist Officer Name: Coroner Dr. Brown Officer Context: Assessed an injured individual, provided clues to the property crime. Officer Role: Medical Examiner Officer Name: Patrol Officer Gonzalez Officer Context: Collected testimonies from surrounding businesses about suspicious activities. Officer Role: Community Relations Officer
